title: Introduction to Scientific Notation
text: Scientific notation is a way to express very large or very small numbers. It is written as the product of a number (usually between $$1$$ and 10) and a power of $$10$$.

title: Understanding the Negative Exponent
text: When there's a negative exponent in scientific notation, it signifies the number is less than one. However, we must move the decimal point to the left instead of the right as in a positive exponent case.

title: Decimal Placement
text: How will the decimal place move when converting $$8{10}^{-6}$$ to standard notation?

title: Shifting the Decimal Point
text: In the number $$8{10}^{-6}$$, you start with the number $$8$$, then move the decimal point $$6$$ places to the left due to the negative exponent.
